In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in splitstrip(text)
        if occursin(r"^\s+$", word) || length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here's an example usage:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
Pellentesque at semper odio.
"""

formatted_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(formatted_text)
```
This will split the `text` into lines with a maximum width of 20 characters.
